awd_titl_txt: Mathematical Sciences:  Random Walks and Hydrodynamic       Scaling
awd_abstract_narration: The statistical mechanics of various dynamical systems is an  important area of research which has seen a high concentration of  recent active research. The major objective of this research is  to develop estimates for physical dynamics where the random walks  contribute microscopically. These random noises will behave  differently under different scales, and therefore provide models  for various physical phenomena. The estimates to be developed  will help control the magnitude of the fluctuation fields  introduced by the random noises at different scales. It will also  allow a quantification of the evolution behavior under different  scale and a better understanding of chaotic structures.  Many models of physical phenomena are being explained by the  interaction of particles at the microscopic level. Different  interactions at the microscopic level lead to  different  macroscopic structures. The study of these models leads to  fundamental progress in material sciences, chemical engineering  and biological engineering. This research is a continuation of  the study of the random interaction between particles in  statistical mechanics.
